title: Ted Bundy’s Ex-Girlfriend To Star In New Series That’ll Narrate Story From A Female Perspective
text:
For 40 years, they kept mum and avoided the spotlight. Finally, American serial killer Ted Bundy’s girlfriend and daughter will break their silence in new Amazon Prime Video series that will tell his story from a female perspective.

Twitter

Ted Bundy who raped and killed over 30 women in the United States had dated Elizabeth Kendall in the ‘70s. Her daughter Molly, who’ll also be a part of the new docu-series, was a toddler at that time and was partly raised by her.

metro.co.uk

Elizabeth Kendall was the one who named him as a possible suspect from women’s disappearance. She even wrote a book about her experience in 1981. But since then, she hasn’t spoken about it publicly.

independent.co.uk

“After nearly 40 years of silence, Elizabeth Kendall and her daughter Molly share their experiences with unsettling new details about Bundy, the pull he had on women and an abundant archive of never-before-seen family photos,” reads Amazon’s official announcement.

Twitter

“Bundy's crimes from a female perspective -- uncovering the disturbing and profound way in which Bundy's pathological hatred of women collided with the culture wars and feminist movement of the 1970s, culminating in what is perhaps the most infamous true-crime saga of our time," the statement added.

Twitter

Conversations with a Killer: The Ted Bundy Tapes, which had released on Netflix some time ago, made a lot of waves for it offered a look into the real recordings done by Ted Bundy.
description: It will be a five-part docuseries that will air on Amazon Prime. The series will amplify female voices. Titled Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer, the series is expected to release in 2020.
